Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tourniquet Use in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 71 patients (79 knees) undergoing TKA were randomised

Participants.evidence: The study was conducted at a single institution. Eligibility criteria excluded high-risk patients for tourniquet-related complications.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either continuous tourniquet use from incision through cementation (operative tourniquet group) or tourniquet use only during cementation (cementation tourniquet group)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effects of limited tourniquet use during cementation only.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was surgical time

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 71 patients (79 knees) undergoing TKA were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found between groups in surgical time, pain scores, pain medication requirements, range of motion, hemoglobin change, or total blood loss.

Harms.evidence: One major complication, compartment syndrome, occurred in the operative tourniquet group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
